mim.author: edutmic
mim.name: BscFunction
mim.description: Contains the BscFunction part of the BSC node model.

struct.name: ErrorLogItem
struct.description: Error log for a failed configuration transaction in the BSC.

structMember.name: dn
structMember.description: Distinguished name for the class where the transaction failed.

structMember.name: errorMessage
structMember.description: Error message information about the failure.

structMember.name: mmlCommand
structMember.description: MML command that failed. If the failure was not due to a failed command, this field will be empty.

structMember.name: progressPercentage
structMember.description: Progress of the activity. The range is between 0 and 100.

structMember.name: progressInfo
structMember.description: Textual information that describes the actual state of the activity execution.

structMember.name: timeStarted
structMember.description: Date and time when the current activity was started.

structMember.name: timeCompleted
structMember.description: Date and time when the activity was completed (successfully or unsuccessfully).

structMember.name: timeOfLastUpdate
structMember.description: Date and time when the activity was last updated.

struct.name: EventFilter
struct.description: Struct used to specify the event filter criteria.

structMember.name: filterName
structMember.description: Filter name. This member contains the name of the referenced EventFilterType MO instance, found in key attribute eventFilterTypeId.

enum.name: BasicAdmState
enum.description: Basic administrative states for a resource.

enumMember.name: LOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively prohibited from performing services for its users.

enumMember.name: UNLOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively permitted to perform services for its users. This is independent of its inherent operability.

enum.name: SessionState
enum.description: Actual job state for an event job.

enumMember.name: ACTIVATING
enumMember.description: The job is switching from STOPPED to ACTIVE.

enumMember.name: ACTIVE
enumMember.description: The job is producing events as intended.

enumMember.name: DEACTIVATING
enumMember.description: The job is switching from ACTIVE to STOPPED.

enumMember.name: STOPPED
enumMember.description: The job is passive, by request or because of other reasons.

enumMember.name: FAILED
enumMember.description: The job is permanently failed and deactivated. In this state it will not respond to further attempts to activate it. The job leaves the FAILED state and enters the STOPPED state if the failure reason is removed.

enumMember.name: GZIP
enumMember.description: GNU zip file compression type.

enumMember.name: SINGLE_SELECT
enumMember.description: Select one value only from a defined set of options.

enumMember.name: MULTI_SELECT
enumMember.description: Select multiple values from a predefined set, separated by a space.

enumMember.name: INTERVAL
enumMember.description: Select an interval value within the specified range.

enumMember.name: DISTINGUISHED_NAMES
enumMember.description: Select one or more DNs.

enumMember.name: REGEXP
enumMember.description: Regular expression.

enumMember.name: TRACE
enumMember.description: Trace logging level. All messages are included in the log file.

enumMember.name: DEBUG
enumMember.description: Debug logging level. Messages with logging levels DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, and FATAL are included in the log file.

enumMember.name: INFO
enumMember.description: Info logging level. Messages with logging levels INFO, WARN, ERROR, and FATAL are included in the log file.

enumMember.name: WARN
enumMember.description: Warning logging level. Messages with logging levels WARN, ERROR, and FATAL are included in the log file.

enumMember.name: ERROR
enumMember.description: Error logging level. Messages with logging levels ERROR and FATAL are included in the log file.

enumMember.name: FATAL
enumMember.description: Fatal logging level. Messages with logging level FATAL are included in the log file.

enum.name: JobControl
enum.description: The level of MS control of the PMEvent job.

enumMember.name: FULL
enumMember.description: MS has Full control of the PMEvent Job. MS can create, delete, start and stop a job.

enumMember.name: STARTSTOP
enumMember.description: MS has restricted control of the PMEvent Job. MS can stop and start a job but cannot delete or create it. The selection of this option for predefined jobs indicates that no event can be added or removed. Updates can only be done to the request state, destination attributes and job group under EventJob MOC. eventGroupRef and eventTypeRef are not modifiable in this condition.

enumMember.name: VIEWONLY
enumMember.description: MS can only view the PMEvent job.

enum.name: ProgressResult
enum.description: Lists the different results of an activity.

enumMember.name: NOT_AVAILABLE
enumMember.description: No result is available yet.

enumMember.name: SUCCESS
enumMember.description: The activity ended with success.

enumMember.name: FAILURE
enumMember.description: The activity ended with failure.

enumMember.name: FINISHED
enumMember.description: The activity is finished.

enumMember.name: PENDING
enumMember.description: The activity is waiting for other activities to finish.

enumMember.name: RUNNING
enumMember.description: The execution of the activity is currently in progress.

enumMember.name: DISABLED
enumMember.description: The resource is totally inoperable.

enumMember.name: ENABLED
enumMember.description: The resource is partially or fully operable.

enum.name: JobState
enum.description: Job state that has been requested.

enumMember.name: ACTIVE
enumMember.description: The job is requested to be activated.

enumMember.name: STOPPED
enumMember.description: The job is requested to be stopped.

enumMember.name: INCONSISTENT_VERSIONS
enumMember.description: CP dump and APT Configuration Mediation Module versions are inconsistent. Use OPI Function Change, Configuration Mediation Module, Initiate to perform install/update of APT Configuration Mediation Module which corresponds to the CP dump version on executive CP side.

derivedDataType.name: DateTime
derivedDataType.description:
Represents the International Standard for the representation of date and time ( ISO 8601). The string format is "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ" (excluding quotes). A DateTime string consists of a date part followed by a time part. When the time part represents local time, as opposed to UTC time indicated by Z as last character, an additional time offset part is added to the DateTime string.
The following pattern describes the DateTime format in detail: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.S+][Z|+-hh:mm] Where: YYYY = four digit year MM = two digit month (01=January, etc.) DD = two digit day of month (01 through 31) T = time designator (shows start of time component) hh = two digits of hour (00 through 23, AM/PM not allowed) mm = two digits of minute (00 through 59) ss = two digits of second (00 through 59, leap second not allowed) S+ = one or more digits of decimal fraction of a second Z = time is Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) +- = + or - character indicating positive or negative offset to UTC
DateTime values are compliant with ISO 8601 "Representation of dates and times" but are restricted according to RFC 3339 "Date and Time on the Internet: Timestamps". The DateTime format is further restricted: - T and Z designators are upper case. - . (dot) is used to indicate start of fractions of seconds (ISO 8601 also allows comma)

derivedDataType.name: DerivedString
derivedDataType.description: A derived string with valid values as given below. regexp [a-zA-Z0-9-]+

derivedDataType.name: IpDNSAddress
derivedDataType.description:
The IpDNSAddress type represents an IP address or a DNS domain name.
A version 4 IP address is specified in dotted quad notation, for example 130.100.92.154. RFC 791 describes the syntax in detail. A version 6 IP address is specified by 8 groups of 16 bit hexadecimal values separated by colons, for example, 2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334. RFC 4291 describes the syntax in detail. A DNS name is specified as a fully qualified domain name, for example, myhost.ericsson.com. The internet domain is loosely specified but RFC 1034 recommends a syntax.

derivedDataType.name: DerivedStringName
derivedDataType.description: A derived string with valid values as given below. regexp [a-zA-Z0-9-_ ]+

class.name: BscFunction
class.description: Contains BSC specific data to configure the GSM network.

attribute.name: bscFunctionId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: release
attribute.description: The product release of the ManagedFunction. It commonly contains the Managed Function release, for example L12.0, 13A, R1A

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Used for product free-text description.

class.name: BscMAdministration
class.description: Contains administration of availability of the BscM content.

attribute.name: bscMAdministrationId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: bscMAdministrativeState
attribute.description: Wanted state of the BSC Model Based Configuration Management.

attribute.name: bscMOperationalState
attribute.description: Current state of the BSC Model Based Configuration Management.

attribute.name: disabledReason
attribute.description: APMML disable reason. The reason why bscMOperationalState is DISABLED while bscMAdministrativeState is UNLOCKED.

class.name: SyncProgress
class.description: Progress information for synchronization of BSC data.

attribute.name: syncProgressId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: progressInfo
attribute.description: Progress information for synchronization of BSC data.

class.name: ConfProgress
class.description: Configuration progress for configuration of BSC data.

attribute.name: confProgressId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: progressInfo
attribute.description: Progress information for configuration of BSC data.

class.name: ErrorHistory
class.description: Error history for failed transactions in the BSC.

attribute.name: errorHistoryId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: errorLogItem
attribute.description: Error history item for failed transactions in the BSC.

attribute.name: bscMInformationId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: bscMMoNumber
attribute.description: Number of managed objects.

class.name: PmEventM
class.description: The PM Event Management fragment. It is used to manage the event jobs on the Managed Element. Once an event job is activated the events can be collected and sent via streaming.

attribute.name: pmEventMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: EventProducer
class.description:
Event Producer.
Allows for multiple types of Event Producer within an Application describing distinct Event functions and capabilities.
This MO is created by the system.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='maxNumberOfEventJobsId' test="count(EventJob) le 1"> Maximum of one EventJob MO can be created under <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='maxNumberOfEventJobsId' test="count(EventJob) le 1"> Maximum of one EventJob MO can be created under <name path="."/></assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: eventProducerId
attribute.description:
Holds the name used when identifying the MO.
This is non-empty sequence of characters matching the regexp [a-zA-Z0-9-]+

attribute.name: eventProducerName
attribute.description:
The name of the Event Producer.
This is human readable and has the value regexp [a-zA-Z0-9-_ ]+

class.name: EventCapabilities
class.description:
Event capabilities.
This MO is created by the system.

attribute.name: eventCapabilitiesId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: maxNoOfJobs
attribute.description: Defines the total maximum number of Event Jobs supported by the application.

class.name: EventFilterType
class.description:
Describes the available Event Filter Type definitions.
This MO is created by the system.

attribute.name: eventFilterTypeId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: defaultValue
attribute.description: Defines format of filter type value.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Describes the Event Filter Type.

attribute.name: filterMethod
attribute.description: Method of filter classification.

attribute.name: valueSpec
attribute.description: Specifies the possible values.

class.name: EventGroup
class.description:
Represents a group of the related Event Types.
This MO is created by the system.

attribute.name: eventGroupId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Describes the content and purpose of the event group.

attribute.name: eventGroupVersion
attribute.description:
Specifies the Event Group version identifier.
Unique version identifier associated with a change to the contents of the Event Group, where new Event Types have been added.

attribute.name: generation
attribute.description:
Specifies the Switching domain or domains to which this measurement is applicable.
For e.g. GSM, UMTS, EPS, GSM/UMTS.

attribute.name: validFilters
attribute.description: Defines valid filter type definitions for this Event Group.

class.name: EventJob
class.description:
Defines the information to be used to activate and configure an event job on the Managed Element.
Maximum of one EventJob MO can be created under one parent EventProducer MO instance.

attribute.name: eventJobId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: currentJobState
attribute.description: Specifies the current state of the job.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Describes the content and the purpose of the job.

attribute.name: eventFilter
attribute.description:
Specifies which event filter or filters to be applied.
Specifies the event criteria which must be valid for the events to be collected and what contents some events must have.
The supported filters are specified in the attribute EventGroup.validFilters.
The following conditions apply: The order of the filters does not matter. Only one filter of each type must be set.

attribute.name: eventGroupRef
attribute.description: Specifies the Event Group or Event Groups selected for the job.

attribute.name: jobControl
attribute.description: Describes the level of MS control of the event job.

attribute.name: requestedJobState
attribute.description:
Specifies the requested state of the job.
It represents the state, that the job has been ordered to reach.

attribute.name: streamDestinationIpAddress
attribute.description: The address of the server that event data should be streamed to.

attribute.name: streamDestinationPort
attribute.description: Specifies the server port that event data is streamed to.

class.name: StreamingCapabilities
class.description:
Streaming capabilities.
This MO is created by the system.

attribute.name: streamCapabilitiesId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: supportedCompressionTypes
attribute.description:
Supported stream compression type or types.
If this attribute is not present, the compression of event data streams is not supported.

attribute.name: bscInformationId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: apzType
attribute.description: APZ type.

attribute.name: apgType
attribute.description: APG type.

attribute.name: releaseCode
attribute.description: Internal release code.

attribute.name: upgradeFrom
attribute.description: The previous BSC release.

attribute.name: dateOfUpgrade
attribute.description: Date of the BSC upgrade.

attribute.name: bscRefDump
attribute.description: BSC reference dump ID.

attribute.name: gapApzRelease
attribute.description: Global Application Product APZ release with Correction Note Module.
